c74object.name: sy.replace
c74object.digest: Replace characters or sequences of characters
c74object.description: Substitutes all occurrences of a sequence of character with another one, or deletes them

objarg.name: param
objarg.description: Sets the parameters for the search and replace. the first argument is the first symbol to search, the second argument is the first symbol to substitute, the third argument is the second symbol to search, while the fourth argument is the third symbol to substitute and so on. Use the empty symbol "" to delete a search string, or if you define just two arguments and drop the second one, replace will just delete the searched string.

method.name: anything
method.description: For each incoming symbol, the search characters are searched, and substituted with the corresponding replace characters. The result is then output. Notice that since sy.replace support regular expression, any special regular expression symbol must be escaped with backslashes in order to be used literally.

method.name: bang
method.description: Replace characters of the most recently received input list.

attribute.name: listout
maxdecimals
attribute.digest: Maximum Decimal Digits For Number Conversion
attribute.description: Sets the maximum number of decimals to be used for the conversion from number to symbol, in case the numbers attribute is set to "Convert To Symbol".

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Maximum Decimal Digits For Number Conversion

attribute.name: numin
numout
re
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to use regular expressions for searching (default: off). The regular expression syntax is the standard one, except for capture group, identified via the dollar sign, and not the percentage sign (notice that you might need to escape dollar sign in Max if it is at the beginning of a symbol).

attribute.name: search
attribute.description: Sets the symbol (or symbols) determining the patterns to be searched.

attribute.name: substitute
attribute.description: Sets the symbol (or symbols) containing the patterns to be substituted. Default is the empty symbol (i.e. deletion of matched searched strings). Just send a substitute message with no symbols to delete all matches of searched patterns.

c74object.discussion: sy.replace also supports regular expression. When using the regular expression mode (re attribute), any special regular expression symbol must be escaped with backslashes in order to be used literally. Refer to http://userguide.icu-project.org/strings/regexp for a detailed documentation on accepted regular expression syntax.
